Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel is awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Finn B
Reviews.Content: I stay with some friends at the Four Seasons in SF and love it. The quality and attention to details was amazing and the service was on par with a FS hotel. The hotel is extremely sleek and minimal which has a real air of sophistication. The location is probably the best in SF with the tram directly at the front door and the famous cable car, within minutes walking Overall loved the stay

Reviews.Title: “Great service and staff”
Reviews.Author: dickyhell
Reviews.Content: It was a short business trip to SF, From arriving and checking in to all my further needs the staff at the Four Seasons did everything without fuss. Comfortable room, great pool, a good selection of food. The service I expect from a proper Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for shopping and cable cars”
Reviews.Author: jenaviv
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a very relaxing week at the FS San Francisco. The hotel is the usual FS quality but we were particularly impressed with the location and the truly excellent concierge service. If you want to be close to the shops of Union Square, the cable cars, train to the airport and a short walk to the ferry building then this is your hotel. The concierge was also extremely knowledgable and it was no trouble for her to find out additional information for our more unusual requests. In-room dining and housekeeping also provided excellent service. If you're in San Francisco for more than a day or two I'd recommend the muni multi-day pass which come in 3 or 7 day passes which give you unlimited rides on the cable cars (otherwise v pricey) as well as the v cool but slow f line and the underground. Our favourite days were spent cycling over the GG Bridge (do it) and taking the muni underground to ocean beach, walking in the sea and getting lost in golden gate park across the road. I also enjoyed the spa at Nordstrom in the Westfield shopping centre 2 mins from the hotel and their bistro with a fab view and pasta dishes. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Among the best city hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: umgeni
Reviews.Content: I travel regularly around the world for business staying in 5 star hotels and in my view the Four Seasons San Francisco is among the best city hotels in the world both for business people and travelers. It hard to find fault with anything- the location is perfect central and within easy walking distance of the downtown shopping area, great restaurants and other key SF attractions. The facilities include a world class gym and swimming pool, restaurant quality dining and bar (what an amazing take on the humble chicken club!) and sumptuously furnished rooms with every amenity and convenience possible. The legendary Four Seasons service is always there with the SF hotel unique in my view in instilling the same exceptional service culture in every member of staff - you are without exception treated as a special guest by everyone at the hotel. (Thanks to a bike minded member of the concierge team I arranged to do a truly wonderful bike circuit tour of the Bay area/ Presidio/ Golden Gate Park area). The hotel was great value on my corporate rate but even at regular rates is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hospitality, live up the reputation”
Reviews.Author: TwiddyandCompany
Reviews.Content: Front desk folks consistently were extremely helpful, patient, and knowledgeable. From the front door to the concierge, we were really impressed with their professionalism. Will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scottkel
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay... Front desk staff was very cheerful and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: t d
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous. The room was amazing, lots of windows on two walls so great views of the city. The bed was so comfortable and perfect. The bathroom was huge and the amenities very nice. Wish I could have stayed longer. I can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes Reputations Are Justified”
Reviews.Author: RTL212
Reviews.Content: I was recently in San Francisco on business and have a matter there that will bring me back every month or so for the next year. I stayed at the Ritz Carlton for the first few days -- I'd stayed there over a dozen times in past years so looked forward to returning. For reasons I mentioned in my not-so-flattering review of the latter, I moved to the Four Seasons and found it to be the predictable respite it has always been: high quality contemporary design, the finest materials and a discreet staff (for contrast, I criticized the Ritz Carlton staff for their "happy talk" intrusions to the point where they will interrupt your conversations with colleague to insert some vapid, memorized blather). At the Four Seasons, the staff act like adults who are there to make your stay comfortable and efficient. They are there when you need them and keep out of your way when you don't. The public spaces are very comfortable with excellent seating areas where you can have private conversations with friends and colleagues. One complaint -- the bar/light dining area adjacent toe the restaurant was very noisy, the music so loud we had to move back to the lobby for conversation. The rooms a very comfortable, the bathrooms large and well equipped -- but the room are the one drawback. I've found the Four Seasons chain to be among the good ones offering thoughtful, elegant contemporary design. The rooms here seem very boring, dull, lacking in any design imagination. One negative annoyance, nothing grave but it does matter -- for $500 a night, I don't want to be charged for wireless. The Four Seasons (and the Ritz, for that matter) persist in the highly offensive habit of trying to hit you for $14.95 a day for wireless. The answer is "no" -- be sure to let the front desk know you have no intention of paying for wireless, and they'll understand. Also, the pettiness extended to the business cents,r that seemed to be metering my internet usage, printing, etc. Again, "just say no." Otherwise, the Four Seasons persists in offering the best design, comfort and discreet service of any North American chain. And when in San Francisco, it's vastly better than the tired and confused Ritz Carlton or the Mandarin Oriental, the latter's San Francisco outpost being an exception to that chain's usually elegant hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Always Great!”
Reviews.Author: RussFilice
Reviews.Content: Spent a wonderful weekend in San Francisco (2/24-2/26). I am never let down by The Four Seasons SF. Great Location. Clean rooms/suites. Friendly and engaging staff. My only dislike is that the in-room internet service is very poor, slow, and often unreliable. I have been staying at this hotel since it opened and it has always had the same problem. They should consider not charging for the service anyway. Beside this one issue, the property is terrific! The Sports Club LA is located within the property and hotel guests have full access to the club. This is a fantastic amenity; the club is really wonderful. The adjacent spa is terrific and the hotel salon is equally as great. The hotel restaurant and lounge are pleasant and pretty good. You really don't need to ever leave the property. But, let's face it, it's San Francisco, and there is so much to see right out your front door on Market St. Point off for poor internet in rooms. This is tech crazy San Francisco, common guys, get with it!! Other than that - GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons San Fran Rocked”
Reviews.Author: FlyersFanInLA
Reviews.Content: Great stay with the Four Seasons in San Fran. Killer views. On-it service. Free BMW 7-series "house car" Not that much more $$ than the Westin

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Location in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: mnasf
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for business. The rooms are large by San Francisco standards with great service and a great location. The hotel is combined with the San Francisco Four Season's Residences, but you would never notice. The reception is on the 4th floor (so there is more than one elevator ride to get to your room). The front desk was very friendly and the room was very nice (lots of marble and very comfortable bed). I would love to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons SF”
Reviews.Author: SheriK_12
Reviews.Content: First rate luxury hotel, close to Union Square and lots of shopping, we had a great experience! I would eat out for breakfast, a bit too pricey in the hotel restaurant, otherwise great experience.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the City”
Reviews.Author: Vicki R
Reviews.Content: A peaceful haven from the hustle and bustle of the streets of San Francisco. A warm "welcome back" is the greeting as you are ushered through the hotel doors. A perfectly chilled martini awaits in the dark wood and dimly lit bar with oversized windows and a fabulous view of Market Street below. Rooms are comfortably appointed with the most comfortable beds anywhere. I have stayed at several hotels in San Francisco, and now only stay with Four Seasons. None better.

Reviews.Title: “Class act and a lovey respite.”
Reviews.Author: Melizondo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is what you should expect from Four Seasons. The addition of the Sports Club LA is a real treat. Being able to grab a workout while on the road in such luxury and with such ease is so rare. My favorite hotel now in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Highest of standards as usual”
Reviews.Author: HappyGlamper1820
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Four Seasons San Francisco in early January 2012. The position of the hotel is very centrally located and you can walk to most places even down to Fishermans Wharf. The room was very large and roomy as per usual in a Four Seasons Hotel and the window seat was wonderful for sitting and watching the world on the street below. The Four Seasons never fails in its level of cleanliness. The rooms were immaculately clean and the hotels themselves always have the most beautiful aroma in the hallways and public areas. I have to make mention of Karen at the Concierges desk. She was absolutely marvellous helping us arrange our hire car and even managed to have the car delivered to the hotel for us. She was very helpful and made this part of our trip a lot easier. Thankyou very much Karen. All the staff at the hotel could not have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “It's the Four Seasons So It's Very Good and Very Expensive”
Reviews.Author: sjlm
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent for SFMOMA & other museums, Union Sq shopping and restaurants, financial district. Room and service are fine as you'd expect. A little annoying: 2-elevator-trip to get in and out of the building; advertised courtesy car- starts at 5pm, there is only one, first-come-first-served, expect to take cabs. Really annoying at all Four Seasons: $15/day for Internet access when it is free at many inexpensive and moderately-priced hotels and it is not even available in lobbies. Breakfast at Seasons is reasonably expensive and very nice. Sun & Mon $20-burger-&-wine-or-beer is a good deal. Good alternatives: Mandarin (after their renovation is complete in Spr 2012) for gorgeous views; Ritz Carlton if you don't mind being on Nob Hill.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Melissa T
Reviews.Content: Exceptional service and staff. We LOVE this hotel. We wouldn't stay anywhere else in San Fran. Great location, great rooms and amazing bar!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: criddymonkey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great area for shopping and dining. It is very close to Union Square, Chinatown, and the Westfield mall. We used a car service to and from the hotel, it only takes around 15 minutes to reach the airport. We traveled during the late morning, so we missed rush hour. The room was very nice and clean. The bathroom was great, it has a seperate tub and glass shower. Every staff member we came in contact with was very friendly, we have no complaints. We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant, which was delicious. We would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it. Value delivered as usual.”
Reviews.Author: colorblind123
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Great Service. Value Delivered. Staff bends over backwards.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: tripgal1
Reviews.Content: Warm, wonderful respite although just beyond the doors you're in the busy hub. The lobby is pleasantly situated above ground level and exudes subdued luxury; always breathtaking floral displays. Never crowded yet buzzing with life are the lounge and sitting area close to the fireplace. Love the friendliness, no pretension - from the staff anyway :)! Was warmly greeted by the familiar faces at the concierge and front desk as they welcomed us back. Was upgraded to a beautiful, spacious and updated suite, facing Market. Lots of light, blue hues, windows and space to roam and relax. No noise whatsoever. Bathrooms a teeny bit dated. Couldn't wait to get to the lounge for snacks and drinks. Love their martini's, wasabi snacks and spicy nuts. Again, lots of familiar faces and kindness when they recognized us. (Seems there are many long-time employees throughout the property.) Finished lounging and headed to the dining room. Here is the dangerous part; there is absolutely nothing that comes out of this kitchen that is is NOT divine! No matter how full I ate every last morsel. We had venison, pasta, brussel sprouts, potatoes, wild mushrooms and chocolate mousse cake all served with precision. If only my cooking was a fraction of this caliber...oh how I wish. Next up, breakfast. I wasn't hungry but knew I had to try more of the chef's delectable creations. We had the full egg, meat breakfast and buttermilk pancakes which doesn't sound too exciting but whoa, perfection again! My pancakes are hockey pucks so how is it they make these pancakes so light, fluffy and delicious? Not a morsel left on my plate again. I eat like a pig when I'm here! Ok, time to work off the loads of food and drinks I've ingested. Went up to the gym which had every machine imagineable. Another excellent experience. The gym is enormous, clean and just a convenient ride up the elevator. Didn't swim in the lap pool this visit since I couldn't fit into my swimsuit. Had late checkout so relaxed in the room while catching up on work...was not happy to find an additional fee for internet use. Convenient and accurate checkout, sans hotel credit and breakfast charges. The bell staff were attentive, happy campers and all too accommodating as they loaded up the car and sent us off with water. The absolute best in SF !!

Reviews.Title: “As great as she always was...”
Reviews.Author: TheLuxeTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here since they opened around 2002 and while they certainly had some better years than others, my recent stay was as good as any. It is San Francisco so you occasionally run into some attitude from the staff which has been an issue but not frequent. David, the Concierge is outstanding and has been there since opening day. Also, Morgan in the front drive is helpful and always makes you feel welcomed. This hotel understands luxury and the service, and quality of everything they do is superb. I recommend the Suites, and the one-bedroom suite they have is beyond. You really do feel as though you have your own residence in the midst of the downtown buildings. Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “elegant but not stuffy”
Reviews.Author: Richmondluxurylover
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel for its understated luxury. Convenient to everything S.F. has to offer, it offers a luxurious oasis when you are too tired to do any more sightseeing or shopping. I have to agree with another reviewer about the sleep button however. That one amenity would have made the stay near perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous Four Seasons Experience...”
Reviews.Author: DanAndAssana
Reviews.Content: We were treated fabulously by the front desk. Not only we were acknowledged as a return Four Seasons customer, we received and upgraded room and the check-in clerk personally walked us to the elevators and would have accompany us to our room had we not stopped him. Our suite was spacious and beautifully decorated, Though we felt that the towels were a bit tired, the bedding and amenities were both high quality. The only annoying thing was the lack of free wifi. And the valet service is a whopping 51 bucks!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, limited amenities on Christmas day”
Reviews.Author: williemach
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a night here to celebrate our legal marriage and get some much needed rest and relaxation. It was my first time here even though I live in the city. The service was good, but the spa desk was a different story. The Four Seasons actually has Sports Club LA inside and i'm not sure if the employees are part of the Four Seasons staff. We went there on Christmas day and the staff at the desk seemed eager to leave for the day. The spa and jacuzzi is located inside the Sports Club LA, so when it closed early at 1pm, we were basically out of luck to use the facilities. I'm guessing they could have staffed it differently or told guest that amenities would be lacking on Christmas. Forget about a nice hot jacuzzi! Our room had a view of the top of the Armani Exchange store on Grant and Geary Street and city lights. It was clean and comfortable. There's no coffee maker or press in the room, so you'll need to run downstairs to the Coffee Bean. I'm not sure if i'd stay here again, wasn't quite the Four Seasons I was expecting considering the critical amenities are shared with another company that has a different operating schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a city, what a hotel”
Reviews.Author: LexingtonRose
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed here for 4 nights to celebrate my 50th birthday. I looked long and hard at all of my options, definitely wanted luxury. The Four Seasons gave us just that! Upon our arrival we were greeted very warmly and that warmth and attention to detail lasted the whole trip. The room was fantastic, we were upgraded to a wonderful suite with a HUGE bathroom, all in a very soothing color palate. Room service was great, extremely quick and always with that special Four Seasons touch. The location of the hotel could not have been better, walking distance to everything with the most fantastic shopping right at your door. Everything about the trip was incredible, we absolutely made the right decision on going to San Francisco, the Four Seasons was the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Al-Sue-Maine
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights there last week, for a mini-vacation. The hotel is beautiful, the staff is very friendly and accomodating (very warm, as were most people in San Fran!) The room was large, and the bathroom was over-sized and very well appointed. Room service, while expensive, was very efficient. Only 2 downsides from our POV; no coffee pot in the room (not uncommon in 4 star hotels), and the listed address is not where you go if arriving by car - that is a mailing address. They had a card printed up with the directions to the valet parking/arrival area, so we're obviously not the first that it's happened to, and they could have had more info on that on their website. But these are small issues, the hotel and staff overall are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “great location for christmas shopping”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaDaisy
Reviews.Content: Second visit, this stay executive suite for one night. The room is ok, the layout is a little odd for a family, better for business? There is a hall with bedroom and bath, and then a separate sitting area. We had three in our group-mom, daughter and grandma and it worked well, one king bed and pull out sofa. I thought the sitting area felt a little claustrophobic, but the bedroom was large, and pleasant. Staff professional, and helpful. Breakfast in the restaurant was very good. Work out area is superb, a regular health club within hotel that guests have access to, lots of machines, free weights and classes-excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Our Ultimate in Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaTraveler49
Reviews.Content: Our business meeting was at the Four Seasons. We traveled to San Francisco prior to our meeting starting so we could spend time in the city. We have never experienced the service, comfort and 'home like' experience in a hotel before. I don't know how they attract the staff they have but who ever is responsible deserves a promotion. The most professional staff we have ever seen. They treated us like their favorite relatives. They couldn't do enough for us and we felt like royalty. If you plan to be staying in San Francisco this is the place to stay. What ever the price, it's worth it. We felt the food, service and value was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel that allows you to have a very "un-touristic" stay right in the heart of the city. Great location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Petra T
Reviews.Content: This of course is a luxury hotel, however its location really makes it great for leisure stay in the city. The design of the hotel is very different in that it doesn't "scream" hotel, but resembles more of a residential structure. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay over the weekend and walked everywhere. The only small negative is that there is no Wi-Fi in the rooms, so trekking down to the Business Center in a robe (provided) to use the internet is out-of-the-question. Rooms are beautiful and the view of Market Street is beautiful day and night. We had no trouble with noise or anything else - strongly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “exellent”
Reviews.Author: Annat Y
Reviews.Content: The delax room at floor 12 with sea view was fantastic. Two twin bad are too small each - should be quine size

Reviews.Title: “Effortless luxury”
Reviews.Author: GothamAdventurer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons SF for one night on our way to Napa Valley. The hotel was fantastic on every level and exceeded expectations. - Upon check-in we were shown two different rooms to chose from. The front desk clerk personally showed us the rooms and carried our bags. He was an extremely friendly person and even offered dining tips. - The room was elegantly furnished and the bed was extremely comfortable. It was also perfectly quiet and had a fantastic view over market street, the bridges, and the mountain ranges beyond the city. - That evening we ate at the hotel's dining room. It is lively yet elegant. You can wear anything from jeans to a cocktail dress and you'll feel at home. The wine list is contained on ipads, pretty neat. food was great, service speedy. - The gym attached is a Sports Club LA which has excellent audio/video at each cardio machine as well as an extensive array of free weight equipment. It is free to use. - The concierge really went out of his way and made a last-minute car rental extremely straightforward. He did all of the arranging for me and had the car brought right to the hotel. I was even upgraded for free to a mercedes... - All in all a fantastic urban oasis that exceeded expectations on every dimension.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time by the Bay!”
Reviews.Author: bvlovetraveling
Reviews.Content: We took my father to San Francisco for a nice family get together...we each had Our own rooms. Overall, very nice hotel and good location. My wife works at Disney so we had a discounted rate...I think for the regular price, I am not sure this is a five tar hotel that caters to their guests. When we were checking in, one of the guests was arguing with front desk...nice!!! Also, what five star hotel charges for wifi...really!!! At those prices you are charging for wifi...give me a break. Lucky for us we had the discounted rates because otherwise I would gave been upset. Even at those rates, I still think it is a nice hotel with nice rooms and amenities. I would definitely stay there again but not for full price

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: HoustonPineypoint
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service and great rooms. A place you want to come back to at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons quality"”
Reviews.Author: gklongo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two nights at the FS in San Francisco. We went for our tenth anniversary. This was our first visit to this four seasons but we have stayed in Maui and Seattle as well. We were not disappointed. The hotel was excellent as always! The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We took a special bottle of wine to dinner we had saved to celebrate our tenth anniversary. The cork was not salvageable for a keepsake(we didn't even ask) but the next morning we received a card under our door with the label from the bottle pressed to it and a nice note from the staff wishing us many more happy years(-; My husband hadn't told the front desk we were celebrating our anniversary so when they discovered this the first night, they sent champagne and strawberries up the next day. They really go out of their way to make every visit extraordinary. We look forward to many more visits to Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy N
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons San Francisco for a week during a conference and I couldn't have been more impressed. The hotel is conveniently located on Market Street... You can walk to almost everything - Food, businesses, and shopping are all right there. I enjoyed a morning workout at the Sport Club LA which is also conveniently located next door and is a simple elevator ride away. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable with plush bedding and great amenities. If you're in the mood for some Mexican food there is a great restaurant around the corner nice wine bar you can hit up on the way. If you're in need of a little pick-me-up in the morning the Coffee Bean is right down the street! :)

Reviews.Title: “Cocktails in the bar”
Reviews.Author: lmbunl95
Reviews.Content: this was my first time having cocktails in the lounge/bar area and let me say I will definately go back and take everyone with me. The host was fantastic with prompt service and even after we consumed quite a few glasses of champagne, gave us the bottle price instead of charging for each glass. Wish more places would recommend that and take care of you. They had an excellent choice of wine and cocktails as well as great nibblers. The setting was relaxed and not pretentious at all.

Reviews.Title: “Calm luxury”
Reviews.Author: PeripateticJohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons for a couple of days with my wife while visiting San Francisco. After having selected another, "trendier and younger" hotel, and having had to abandon it in horror, we found refuge in this island of elegance. If you have a car, bear in mind the entrance is not in the front, so you have to go around through some back streets which isn't quite so easy. We booked a suite, which was comfortable and relaxing in an easy, simple and modern way. A plus is also the art collection of the hotel which graces many public spaces and is of particular interest. Staff is helpful and the concierge guided us efficiently to a nice restaurant. Location is good and walking around San Francisco is quite fun. However I have to say, we didn't find the city so great as everyone seems to think. There were some shady areas, the fisherman's warf was a tourist trap and in general I'm afraid we weren't that impressed. The suburbs by the sea are more worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Comfortable, and Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: dobbet
Reviews.Content: Stayed there two nights in October 2011 for a conference. Superior room and bed. A truly excellent experience. I was very pleased. Hotel is exceptionally clean, well maintained, well located, and the staff is trained to a superior level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Love the staff and rooms. Great place to call home when in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: Marcel S
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons - San Fran is a great place and always makes me feel welcome. It really does fell like home away from home. The restaurant is extremely accommodating in preparing food just as you like. The gym is out better then my gym in Austin, TX.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: KweenKayo
Reviews.Content: A true oasis of calm and beauty! Excellent location and appreciated the private car to take us to dinner. Enjoyed the bar each night with our friends, with excellent bar menu as well for lighter dining. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I would expect from Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: HK_matkalla
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights during our California roadtrip. To start with the positives, the location was great: right in the middle of market street, with good public transportation connections to all major sights. The rooms were outdated, and didn't provide the value I would've expected based on the rate and the other hotels we have stayed at of same category. The hotel gym and spa were located outside the hotel premises, making them difficult and impractical to access. Overall, needs a complete update.

Reviews.Title: “Where was our complimentary upgrade?”
Reviews.Author: sunfun18
Reviews.Content: I see in the previous review that those people were given a complimentary upgrade to a suite. When we checked in, we were offered to be upgraded to a slightly larger room for an additional $150 per night although it was clear that the hotel was very empty the days we were there. I am now curious as to why some people are offered a complimentary upgrade and some people are asked to pay for an upgrade. Nevertheless, we did not want to pay even more than we were paying, so we declined. The room was nice. It was on a high floor facing away from Market street, which I suppose is quieter, but not completely quiet as you can still hear sirens, for example. We could also hear our neighbors through the connecting door. Luckily there were not many people on our floor and it was very quiet floor. We never saw any housekeeping staff at all. That is a nice feature. Many times we have stayed at hotels and the housekeeping staff is always in the hallways. The breakfast was at the hotel was pretty good. That is the only meal we ate there. The gym is a huge two story facility with about every piece of equipment you can imagine, but it is a local gym which services the hotel. So while it has everything you need, it also has a large clientele working out there. It's nice that it has a pool, but at the same time, I had to wait for a lane to open up. We had massages, which were average, nothing special. The staff are all very helpful. The only problem was upon leaving the hotel, the hotel's printed instructions to the airport sent us through construction work in the neighborhood and it took us 20 minutes to leave the immediate neighborhood. I think the staff should have known that this was going on and redirected us to a less congested route (which there was).

Reviews.Title: “Usual Great Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Cathyc7
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded to a really nice suite, but even so, the hotel was wonderful. We had nice views, great room service and a pretty good location. It is just the Four Seasons at its usual standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location, very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: lainie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days and totally enjoyed it. The location was excellentâ€¦.close to Union Square, Westfield Shopping Centre, F Line Tram Cars. We certainly had no problems getting around the city from here. The room was huge. It had 2 closets, a very comfy king-size bed, 2 comfy chairs and a desk with 2 more chairs. The bathroom was huge! It had a separate tub and enclosed shower (all done in marble) and a separate room for the toilet. We had a room on the 9th floor and had a great view. Huge big windows with a cushioned area at the bottom to sit and relax (if you have time!). The staff in this hotel were amazing. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. The concierge staff provided great information when we had any queries. And the doormen were always very attentive. All in all, we had a great stay but this hotel is VERY expensive. Even the internet access was overly priced. You would think that for what we paid for the room that we would get free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Good customer service”
Reviews.Author: arualpalm
Reviews.Content: Aesthetics of hotel had no flaws whatsoever. Room/bathroom very clean. We were fortunate enough to have a nice view from 16th floor. Good location close to shopping and restaurants. Gym is spectacular. Outstanding customer service wowed me. Finding the parking was confusing, even with the outside bellhop's directions; once we phoned the hotel, the receptionist was able to give us better directions. Do not expect any freebies at this hotel. I give this hotel four stars, as I really do not know if the $500+ room rates are justified; I would have preferred to stay elsewhere and save $200.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay In San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: RussFilice
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons San Francisco is one of my favorite places to stay while in San Francisco. Great location and legendary Four Seasons service. However, the rooms are becoming tired. They are kept clean, but need to could stand a "re-fresh". My favorite rooms sit on the corner of the building and end in #2.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: JoeVirginia
Reviews.Content: Usually stay at RC on Nob Hill but went to 4Seasons for change. Very impressed with quality of room, extremely comfortable bed (very key), and spacious/well laid out bathroom. had casual dining in lounge and food/service/atmosphere was excellent. The staff directed us to the farmers market a few blocks away that was simply wonderful. Very peaceful and quiet. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adear
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with very large and clean rooms. Excellent service from everyone. Great location with easy walking to many sights. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the bests I have been to”
Reviews.Author: Mifiki
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The location couldn't be better, staff friendly, correct and supportive, magnificent large rooms with plenty of space, bathroom with all you can need and more, great room service, clean, high level, breakfast that I still miss, everything. Highly recommended. My husband loved the incredible gym and swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “FS San Francisco - the only place to stay in the cuty”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: We had a sports weekend in the city. Fresno State vs Cal @ Candlestick and Giants vs Diamonbacks. Although the outcomes of both games were not the outcome we wanted but our stay, AS ALWAYS, at the Four Seasons was the best. Everyone that we came into contact with went over and above to make our stay great. A MUST stay in San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, calm, stylish.”
Reviews.Author: DJDB
Reviews.Content: My second stay here, again excellent. I was in a slightly smaller room than last time, without the little area for the desk, but it was still gorgeous. I got a city view room this time, on the top floor, so had a terrific perspective of Union square and the hotels that surround it. As usual I spent a gret deal of time in Seasons bar, which i love visiting even if not staying, but its great to be able to hang out in the living room by the fire when everyone else has left. It was great to see all the staff again, and I'm looking forward to hosting my mother's 65th birthday lunch there. The interior design and art in the hotel is utterly gorgeous, they did a fabulous job. Yes it is expensive, and that maybe why its only ranked 11, but its a near faultless hotel. I just wish it had its own pool and spa, rather than sharing the LA fitness next door.

Reviews.Title: “At Home in Style”
Reviews.Author: TheStandardBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Rest assured for a last minute change of plans and requiring a one nighter of a Hotelstay it is reassuring to know that there is a Four Saesons or Ritz Carlton in the Neighbourhood provided ones budget extends to that of course; but as Joel Goodson (aka Tom Cruise) in Risky Business said 'What the #@&$!" Like other Four Seasons the San Fran version is a sanctury of peace and civility. As usual the service standard is top notch and it is always nice to addressed my name by staff. How these guys remember ones name let alone pronounce them correctly is remarkable!Though some are excused for trying this is what you expect from one of the worlds prestige establishments. The SF FS does however seem more suited to the business traveller than a tourist. It is not a resort style hotel. There is access to very large LA Sports Club with pool. Our room was beautifully appointed with the obligutory marble bathroom and there was a cute bay window seat with great view of down town SF which our two year old son particularly enjoyed. The location is great right on Market Street with all the s Union Square top name shops and Westfield SF at your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely respite for a couples' getaway”
Reviews.Author: S K
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here as part of short getaway with museum visits and seeing city sights. Lovely quiet nights, very helpful concierge, scrumptious breakfast to start an active day...all contributed to a delightful stay that helped us make the most of our time in the city. Starting the day with a great view wasn't bad, either.

Reviews.Title: “The lap of luxury -- at an affordable rate.”
Reviews.Author: Millby40
Reviews.Content: I struggled with where to stay on my recent trip to San Fran. So on a whim, I checked the Four Season's website and found a bed and breakfast package. The staff is flawless! Upon checking in, they upgraded my room. And I inquired with the concierge about returning my rental car. His response: just hand me the valet ticket and rental contract. That was it! I am a fan of this property. Oh! The breakfast was excellent even if a little pricey. Good thing I got the B&B package.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Underwhelming and Not Amazing”
Reviews.Author: MintChip17
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights here and while it was a pleasant and comfortable stay, it was very underwhelming and bland as far as Four Seasons hotels go. If it weren't for the logo at the entry, one would never know it was a Four Seasons - this hotel felt like any number of big city four-star chain hotels rather than the five-star experience one would normally expect from a Four Seasons (such as the ones in NY or LA or from similarly rated properties like Peninsula). There's no wow-factor either in the public areas or in the blandly furnished and ordinary looking rooms. The staff is friendly but no one goes out of their way (however the valet guys were very prompt and friendly). We had to call housekeeping to have the room made up when we returned around 2:30 and it hadn't been done yet -- then they came by only 3 hours later to provide turndown, which we had to postpone. They also forgot to deliver the waters they offered - only remembering when we had to call a second time to get a replacement fan for the one that rattled (the second one rattled as well). They were super nice but sadly, like so many hotels these days, one can't help but feel they are probably overworked and understaffed. On the plus side, the rooms are very spacious, clean and comfortable and the bathroom was large with nice L'Occitane products. The location is good as well. Overall we had a completely nice stay and the price was very reasonable for a Four Seasons hotel, but perhaps that's because this hotel feels one star below other FS properties. Go here expecting a very pleasant experience but don't go expecting to be knocked out by 5 star service and luxury.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco Staple”
Reviews.Author: PrimroseHill219
Reviews.Content: What can I say, it is after all the Four Seasons. Service was superb, room was spacious. Service was attentive. Only drawback was the fact that the pool were not equipped for kids. My daughter even though she is 12 and is a capable swimmer, was not allowed to swim there. Instead she had to walk to Marriott Hotel, a couple of blocks away just to swim, which was ridicolous

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: justme2Georgia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location for attending a convention at the Moscone center and also close to shoping and the cable cars. The hotel rooms are large, with basic amenities, desk with multiple plugs, lots of storage space, bathroom with separate tub and shower. Turndown service included a complimentary bottle of water. Plenty of Walgreens and CVS around if you want to pick up something. No coffee in the room, but it was available in the lobby. Very few personnel around, but I was normally able to find someone to help. There was a slight delay when looking for the bellman in the afternoon. My view from the 6th floor was okay - ask for a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing & Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: patrickwNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th stay at the Four Seasons in San Francisco & it was such an amazing experience, as always. I was originally due in for only 1 night, but I live in New York City & due to the weather & Hurricane Irene, I had to extend for 2 nights & I was so comfortable during my stay! I was swiftly checked-in by Joel & was upgraded to a really lovely King Premier room, #916. The room was on the corner & had a cool little alcove with a desk & a long hallway leading into the room that really gave a nice sense of space! I loved it! The beds at the hotel are so perfect, I slept so well all 3 nights. The bathrooms are roomy & have cool marble floors, plenty of counter space, amazing deep-soaking tub & separate shower/WC & the typical robes, slippers & L'Occitane products found in all FS properties. My view was of SOMA & is my preferred view at the hotel. The other side fronts Market St, which is nice, but I love being able to see city, mountains & bay from this side of the hotel. The window cushions are also nice. Everything always smells good & everyone at the hotel is nice & efficient. I would like to especially mention Dennis at the Front Desk, who helped me in extending my stay & was able to keep me in 916 for the duration of my stay....he was so nice, incredibly efficient & made me feel at home! Thanks Dennis!! I would also like to mention Kathrin & Rowland from In-Room Dining...they are always polite & very accommodating with special food requests. Each morning I looked forward to the Juice of the day! they have amazing blends:) The hotel is also super quiet & incredibly calm. On each stay, my room has been so quiet & you can't hear anything! very well-insulated building, which is much appreciated in my opinion. The lobby & check-in are on the 5th floor, so you do have to take 2 elevators to get to your room, but this makes me feel very secure. The ground level is a really cool, modern & airy space, with very friendly doormen (always someone to greet me & hold the doors open...amazing job guys!!) & modern artwork, as well as the entrance for the Four Seasons Private Residences. Modern Art is everywhere. Housekeeping did an amazing job on servicing my room everyday! it was spotless each day & so nice to return home to. I really love this hotel. Aside from The St. Regis on 3rd St., it's the only Hotel in San Francisco that I will stay at!! It's such a pleasure to return to & I always look forward to my stays at The Four Seasons, San Francisco! Best Wishes, Patrick Winkler 1 Sept. 11 --

Reviews.Title: “One of the most comfortable hotel i've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy78100
Reviews.Content: One of the most comfortable hotel i've ever stayed. The restaurant has fantastic food and the staff is so nice, very attentive and the concierge are awesome. Great way to be in SF. We'll come back for sure !

Reviews.Title: “Truly exceptional--excellent location and service!!”
Reviews.Author: zwgc2
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Mandarin couple months earlier, which was a pleasant stay by the way, we decided to give the FS a go this time, and it did not disappoint. The location is perfect--on market street and extremely convenient to most places in downtown SF. We stayed in a superior FS executive suite--which seems no different from the "regular"executive suite, is tastefully decorated and very spacious. If you are looking for amazing views, go for the Mandarin. But otherwise, FS wins hands down. Staff were very friendly throughout the stay and most requests and room service were dealt with very quickly and seamless. All in all a truly outstanding hotel and it's definitely worth a try!

Reviews.Title: “Overall very nice ambiance, terrific location, gracious service --but some uneven bits”
Reviews.Author: Tenley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the FS/SF for a mini-vacation. Overall a great value with the extra night free and some preferred partner benefits (breakfasts plus one lunch). Everyone was very nice and gracious. The doormen were particularly welcoming and helpful --snagging cabs and providing useful dining advice. The concierge staff were very nice and helpful with directions but didn't really come up with anything i hadn't already found on on open table or interested in getting reservations to places i couldn't. The room was clean and spacious, lovely bathroom (pristine deep soaking tub-- but no bath salts) and great shampoo products. The room darkening drapes actually overlapped (most hotels seem to have an annoying gap)- big plus. And the window seat was just delightful. Cozy spot to read and look down at the kaleidoscope of Market Street traffic. As manager noted in response to another reviewer, coffee makers & teapots were available on request (but if you don't think to ask... ). Unfortunately the turn down people don't seem used to the idea-- they'd take away dirty mugs but didn't replace them (promptly remedied with a call to housekeeping, but i'd already made the coffee when i noticed...) Oh, another nice thing that could be better-- lovely new TV but many channels not HD. And the written channel listing provided was out of date-- the channel guide on the tv itself was more extensive. And charging for wifi is probably a big profit center but tacky. Less expensive chains provide it gratis. Restaurant was also a bit uneven. The smoked salmon benedict was absolutely perfect. In fact the breakfasts were all lovely, foodwise, and generally timing wise. But one day service was less attentive --maybe it was one particular server who was inattentive--the day she was serving it took forever to get breakfast. We also were disappointed with lunch -- (same day, same server)--- we ordered the soup, asked if it was vegetarian, were assured that it was. and it came served topped with distinctly unvegetarian bacon! We sent it back (i hate being put in the position of having to send food back!) but we could overhear the cook being upset that he hadn't been told to omit it. Waitress seemed indifferent to the error. the rest of the lunch was adequate but not up to the list prices on the menu. it may have just been a bad day or the A team on vacation. Overall a very nice property, comfortable public spaces and service orientation. And great location. But the handful of glitches were surprising.

Reviews.Title: “Ummmm, best hotel ever?”
Reviews.Author: onebackwardglance
Reviews.Content: We come every year for an annual meeting to the Moscone, and have given up on the Palomar (it's desperately in need of upgrading, the windows don't open and they try to sell you those stupid animal print socks and bathrobes). We lucked out with a three nights for the price of two at the Four Seasons, so were able to spend the week here instead. It's unfortunately ruined probably every other hotel in SF for us (and we've stayed at a few), because it is so absolutely perfect. The rooms are quietly elegant, with nothing ostentatious or silly and everything beautifully designed, so that there is none of the "hmmm--where should I put this" sort of thinking that usually has to be done in hotels. The bed, sheets and pillows are the best I've ever slept on; the window opened (hurray!); the room was perfectly quiet; room service is excellent although of course very pricey. Our room looked down on Market Street; as I sat in the window wondering whether a James Perse was somewhere in the area, I noticed that it was directly across the street. The Moscone is a block south, so it's a perfect location for conventions there. And MOMA is right there too. The entrances are slightly hidden, and coming back to the room is like a series of retreats into another world, with the first floor street lobby, then the fourth (I think) floor main lobby--beautiful--and then the deeply quiet and peaceful room. It's difficult to resist stopping in the bar for a drink--it's a beautiful room, with a good wines by the glass list and little pistachio green snacks that are delicious and addicting. I could go on and on--we love this hotel, and wish we could always afford to stay here. Oh, and the room comes with access to a full fitness center, where you watch the comings and goings on Market Street as you do your hour on the elliptical.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Changes2001
Reviews.Content: At its "worst", staying in a Four Seasons is still a generally positive experience, but the San Francisco Four Seasons is one of the best in the chain. Each person was nicer than the next. Room was immaculate and comfortable, L'occitane toiletries, super comfortable bed. Concierge was able to take care of everything (including reservation in another city). And the Sports Club LA is an amazing hotel gym.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: anonymous463
Reviews.Content: we were there 3 nights august 4,5, and 6th. the hotel is incredible. great fitness center, delightful bar and fab rooms. we visit san francisco several times a year and will only stay at the 4 seasons. the staff is very professional and extremely efficient. rent bikes on market and ride across the golden gate bridge into Tiburon and catch the ferry back. also have the concierge make dinner reservations they go out of this way to help with busy restaurants and have great recommendations for new cool places

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: neuros18
Reviews.Content: We're on a 2 1/2 wks trip to west coast of USA with San Francisco being our first stop. Booked Four Seasons throughout the trip based on recommendations from tripadvisor and others. Was looking forward to staying with Four Seasons due to the glowing reviews / reputation and it being our first time with the hotel chain. Alas, when we checked into the room we found the room decor a bit tired and worse, there's this dubious patch on the carpet in front of the couch that's coloured, wet and sticky. Called the front desk to ask for a change of room - was put through to the front desk after 2 transfers, girl babbled something and before I caught what she said, hung up on me!!! When I called back again, was told they're "fully committed" so cannot offer a change of room but that they'd get housekeeping to come take a look. Didn't happen. When we went for dinner, on the way we popped by the front desk and asked again. This time, the guy said the same thing - they're fully committed, but offered us a change of room the 2nd day, supposedly one on a higher floor. However, "the 2nd day" has passed but we've not received anything from the hotel and by now, we've pretty much settled in and too lazy to repack. But still, the quiet is disconcerting. So yesterday we got housekeeping to get us a towel to cover up the gross patch so we won't step on that disgusting sticky substance (again!). They very nicely came and apologised etc. and said they'd have to do the cleaning with a machine and it'd take couple hours to dry. So we said fine, do it in the day time when we're out; When we came back today late afternoon, the room is all made up but the patch is still there! We had to call housekeeping again and this nice old man came with a bucket and spray and proceeded to try and remove it right there and then. Which is rather inconvenient for us but he was apologising all the way and really nice about it so that's not too bad. Finally he said they'd have to use a machine to get it cleaned properly and he'd make a note. Which is exactly what we were told yesterday and nothing got done! I know this is not a serious matter and most of the hotel guys were accomodating and pleasant (except the first girl who hung up on me!!!). However, this is nothing I'd expect from a hotel such as the Four Seasons. Not the dubious sticky patch on the carpet and certainly not the messy, inefficient, ineffective followup that hasn't appeared to have solved anything at all up to now. That being said, the bed's very comfy and the bathroom generously sized. And as we're celebrating our anniversary and hubby's birthday on this trip, they gave us complimentary sparkling wine and strawberries which were a very nice surprise (though not on the actual date, but that didn't matter). I really wanted to love our stay at Four Seasons but up to now, that hasn't seemed possible.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not full marks”
Reviews.Author: havanagirlGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a suite with 2 young children. Check in superbly friendly and efficient, so hats off to the lovely young lady who helped out. Four seasons is a superb chain. Only couple minor hiccups means no 5 star rating. Sofabed wasnt made up for the kids after turndown at 8.20pm and we had to ask. We had to wait 15 mins and ask twice for any service at breakfast. When it came it was excellent but our section of the dining room was neglected. After asking for The kids ages to provide a small treat in the room there was nothing there. Not enough towels in the room and had to ask housekeeping. Having stayed at four seasons beverly hills on the same trip one could see the difference in service. It was very good in areas such as front door and check in and out but not top dollar. Still, the hotel is in a superb location, finishes are excellent and cleanliness ace. Would def return.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch all around!”
Reviews.Author: SunshineGirl302
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this hotel. I stayed here on business and brought my husband along for the ride. Check in was a breeze...as we entered the building, they called up to the front desk and by the time the elevator reached the lobby, someone greeted us, walked us to the front desk and got us checked in in record time. Our room was beautiful; large and spacious with a floor to ceiling window with a great view. There is also a very comfy window seat and the windows opened! The bathroom was marble with a shower and a separate oversized tub. I had drinks in the lounge and ate several meals there during our meetings. One night I tried to book a late massage but they did not have any appointments left so the concierge arranged for an in room massage that was excellent. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance to the Ferry Building, China Town, Coit Tower, etc. and public transportation is right outside the front of the hotel. I would stay here again anytime I visit San Fran! Thanks to the staff for all of the great service! Food Tip: The Grove is a great place for breakfast or lunch which is about a block away from the hotel. Super yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, perfectly located. Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: abuendia1
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, perfectly located. Great Service. Steps from major business and shopping, you can even walk to the piers, fisherman's wharf etc... Concierge was so good that in the restaurants we went they gave us a special gift (drink, snack etc..) from the concierge and that was a great gesture.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is expensive, but delivers top-notch ambiance and service in a fantastic downtown location.”
Reviews.Author: TonyHughes6
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great downtown location (on Market, 2 minutes from Westfield), right in the centre and close to all transport links for the city. The interior lobbies and lounges had a spacious, elegant feel, like stepping out of the bustle into order and calm. We had an Executive Suite on the 17th floor for our 3-day stay, visiting relatives. It was a spacious area with stunning views across the city towards the Bay in the distance. Our two daughters had one room (with a double sofa bed) and we had the other adjoining room (with a king-size bed) which included the bathroom. The suite was well-appointed, extremely clean and (because of the enormous picture windows in both rooms) very light and airy. The bathroom was to die for. A nice touch was the bowl of fruit and the personalised â€˜Welcomeâ€™ card from the hotel manager. We didnâ€™t eat in the hotel (other than a â€˜room serviceâ€™ breakfast, on one of the mornings) but we used the lounge for afternoon tea, pre-dinner drinks and late evening nightcaps. It was a very pleasant space in which to sit and relax, and the staff were extremely (but not annoyingly) attentive. We used the Health Club on one occasion. It was very well-equipped (with a reasonable-sized pool) and on two floors. However, we felt it was more like a city fitness centre than a part of the hotel, so we didnâ€™t feel sufficiently relaxed there â€“ especially compared with all the other club members, who were taking it very seriously! We were particularly impressed with the staff in the hotel. From the Chambermaid to the Concierge, every member of staff we encountered was polite, friendly and made us feel a welcome guest. Nothing appeared too much trouble and a call to Reception produced a knock on the door within five minutes. We did feel that, given the cost of the accommodation, WiFi in the room could have been provided free of charge. We also felt that tea/coffee-making facilities could have been provided in the room. Yes, it was a simple matter to pick up the phone and order it from room service, but we would have preferred the flexibility and immediacy of doing it ourselves. Although the hotel was expensive, we felt it represented good value for money because of the quality of the service and accommodation it provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: velinas
Reviews.Content: This property was in a very central location, but at night very quite! Beautiful big rooms, had lunch in dining room, it was fabulous and they also have a very nice bar area that serves food. The main dining room is closed on Monday night. They have there wine list on Ipad, which is ingenious. They are connected to a fitness club, which you can use, it is amazing. I had a deep tissue massage while I was there, and it was one of the best I have had. They even off Thai massage which I love but need the deep tissue.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you'ld expect at a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: TakumiNY
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very pleasurable short stay at the four seasons. Everything you'ld expect at a four seasons. Highlights included a very comfortable room, super helpful concierge, and a very tasty breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A consistently great place to stay in SF . . .”
Reviews.Author: Austinbe1
Reviews.Content: great service, great location, great fitness facilities. makes you feel totally relaxed. Well worth the extra expense.

Reviews.Title: “Always comfy, service is always top-notch!”
Reviews.Author: lilfoodiegirl
Reviews.Content: We've been staying here every time we come to San Francisco for about 10 years now, once or twice a year to visit friends. We've stayed at almost every other hotel in S.F., but there is no comparison to the Four Seasons. I relax as soon as I enter the modern, elegant lobby. The front desk, bellmen and housekeeping are always extremely helpful. Our beautiful corner room wasn't ready when we checked in, so we had lunch in Seasons Restaurant, delicious! And you get a glimpse of moneyed San Franciscans enjoying their lunch too. Always spotless, always comfortable, we won't stay anywhere else in S.F.!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJstravels_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a family member who went to San Francisco for a business trip. I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. We had booked a regular room, but somehow got upgraded to a "corner room", which I'm not sure if it was still a regular room or a suite, but it was fantastic...large, lots of closet space, big windows looking onto the city, luxurious bathroom, and all the luxuries you'd expect from a Four Seasons. The hotel is in a great location, close to all the great shopping. I got in late at night so I ordered room service which of course was outrageously expensive (a turkey sandwich and slice of chocolate cake somehow came out to almost $50), but very good. The only thing I wasn't impressed with was the lobby, it was a little plain, with one tiny gift shop. Other than that, the hotel was five star.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: alk
Reviews.Content: We were only at the hotel for one night, but it is a lovely hotel. It is in a great location within walking distance to many places. The people at the front desk and concierge desk were very helpful and friendly. The room is clean, comfortable and had great views. We had breakfast at the restaurant and drinks at the bar- both were great. I do have a problem with hotels that charge for Wifi. I think it is a ridiculous charge especially when you are staying at such a high end hotel. Aside from that, I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: mukdennnis
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in a number of resort hotels before hand that were less than attractive, despite their cost. The professionalism of this hotel was great. We arrived really early and they had our room ready. Gym and pool are vast and great and restaurant food was supior with a great view.

Reviews.Title: “A kid-friendly luxury hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DWampold
Reviews.Content: Super friendly and helpful staff. Beautiful guest rooms, comfortable beds and great views!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great attitude”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveller019
Reviews.Content: Top of the line service which seemed natural and unforced make this place. As a longtime Japan resident, I can say I found the Four Seasons one of the only US hotels that can rival this country for service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but the Four Season friendly feeling very hit & miss”
Reviews.Author: Swissbritt
Reviews.Content: Driving to the hotel a little hard for the first time as you have to do a couple of blocks detour to get to the around the back parking.. Once you know it's fine.. On arriving got the usual friendly & welcoming service from the valet.. Then you jump into the lift to the 5th floor to check in.. Again the front desk staff were everything you expect from the Four Seasons, friendly, helpful & welcoming.. The room was great, clean,tidy & had a great view & our luggage arrived 5mins behind us.. Quick freshen up & time to explore.. Generally in a Four Seasons you get to feel like your in a home away from home & not so much a hotel.. But here it just didn't seem to feel that way.. Usually all the staff you encounter wish you a god day/evening whatever.. But not here.. Even the entrance staff just open the door if your lucky but seem scared to or just indifferent to even speak.. This wasn't the case with everyone but in general I'm sad to say it was.. You had to ask for everything & at times it felt like"what are you asking me for?".. In the bars & restaurants normal service was resumed with friendly & helpful staff with excellent service & good food..All in all a very good hotel but when your used to the normal quality & friendly service of Four Seasons Hotel which in general is always the same world wide it's easy to see things when they don't seem to be what you expect.!?!

Reviews.Title: “A predictably superb stay”
Reviews.Author: travelling1935
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal â€” on Market Street, a few minutes from Union Square. The view from your room through those massive windows is everything you can imagine. Most important of all is that, in keeping with the Four Seasons philosophy, the lovely hotel offers a civilized stay. From the pleasantness of the people at reception to the friendliness of the chambermaids, to the warmth of the bar and restaurant staff, this is a hotel eager to guarantee you a comfortable, enjoyable experience. And unlike some so-called luxury hotels, there is no pretentiousness or snobbery here. The bedrooms are comfortable, functional and tastefully appointed. There is a work area and easy chair with proper lighting for reading and recreation. The room safe is unusually large. The bathrooms are marble and well-stocked with soaps and shampoo etc. The bathtub looks luxurious, a temptation to anyone in the mood for a long soak, and the lavatory and shower sensibly occupy separate alcoves. My single experience of room service was excellent. I used the restaurant for breakfast and when I ordered pancakes, the waiter suggested I might want the short stack rather than the full amount. I took his advice, the serving was ample, and I was impressed by the fact that he went out of his way to make a useful suggestion. This is a hotel in which everything meshes exquisitely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bocatravel
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in the heart of the city at market and grand. Union square is a very short walk. Every time I go there I have a fantastic time. The rooms are classic four seasons, great views, and furnishings. The dining room looks down at market street giving a nice view for breakfast. The lobby bar is a nice place to relax after a busy day, great wine list

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, but infrastructure problems, too many glitches for me”
Reviews.Author: susanmccallum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights here on our way to Europe, having canceled our trip to Japan because of the earthquake aftermath. My favorite hotel in the world in the Four Seasons Chinzanso in Tokyo, so almost any hotel is bound to suffer by comparison. Still, I hadn't expected all the problems with the hotel that is ranked in guidebooks as one of the two top hotels in San Francisco. The bed, amenities, bathroom, standard of cleanliness were all what one would expect from a Four Seasons hotel, which is why I gave it 4 stars. The room was very ordinary in terms of decor, the best features being a window seat and an alcove for the desk. But we learned after going to bed that we had "paid" for that extra space by being next to the service elevators, and the swooshing woke us at 5 a.m. The sound proofing was so bad in the alcove that we could hear a phone ring as if in our room and loud voices. The heat came in through the air-conditioning ducts at the ceiling level, so our faces were hot while our feet were cold. And we couldn't keep the heat at a constant temperature. And though we were on the top floor of the hotel, the residences were above us and we had noisy people overhead. Also the black-out curtains overlap nicely, but then the morning light comes in over the top of them. Watch out for Room 1716! The staff was incredibly friendly. Not just smiling "Good mornings" but a real attempt at a conversation. But the friendliness in the end didn't make up for all the glitches in service, ranging from a robe without a sash, a caller being told that my husband wasn't registered at the hotel despite assurances to me that he had been, a higher charge for local phone calls than listed in the room (I was given a credit when I complained). And then there were the odd charges in the restaurant. I ordered chicken soup my first night and was given a bowl that was more stew than soup for $12. My husband ordered it for lunch and it came in a flat soup dish with less in it. On our final day we were again given bowls of it, but mostly broth. We were unhappy, and then learned we had been charged only $6 per bowl. A server told me that I could order a half portion of oatmeal for breakfast, but if that's so, why isn't it on the menu? And way before we left, I asked to have our luggage collected at 11:45 but had to call twice more to get anyone to come. So given that we left more tired than when we arrived, I will look for another hotel in San Francisco on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Erin74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons in San Francisco in November 2010 during a business trip. During my stay, I spent a lot of time in the hotel and attended meetings in the ballroom and conference rooms. Overall, it's a lovely hotel, with the sophistication and good service you would expect from a Four Seasons. If you're driving to the hotel, it can be a little difficult to access the entrance. You'll make a series of turns to get around the side of the hotel, then drive down a poorly marked alley to reach the valet area. You can either valet or park in an adjacent self-park garage. Once parked, registration was quick and easy. I was given a south-facing room on an upper floor, with a nice view towards AT&T park. The room itself was quite nice. Decor was subdued and elegant and the room was spacious and clean. It was very quiet and I was able to get an undisturbed night's sleep. During my stay at the Four Seasons, service was excellent. Every single staff member that I spoke with was helpful and personable. The food (both banquet food in the ballroom and room service food) was great, although certainly not inexpensive. I had no problems at all during my stay. The only real criticism I could give here is that the hotel doesn't have a lot of personality. There's nothing unique or interesting going on here-- just solid, traditional elegance. I'd definitely stay here again if someone else was paying for it!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: NYCDesign78
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked a little dated and uninspiring on their website. Was pleasantly surprised that it looked much better in person and very high quality. Staff were friendly and everything happened smoothly.....a rare feat in travel these days, sadly. Views were nothing special, but the suite was a very nice size. Booked through AmEx. Definitely appreciated the upgrade and the amenity they offer. Not a huge spa person so those usually go wasted, but a food & beverage credit was definitely handy.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to go wrong at the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: cincytraveler123
Reviews.Content: This is a quiet hotel off Market Street in San Francisco. You take an elevator to the lobby and a separate elevator to your guest room. It has a very exclusive feel to it. The hotel bar is very comfortable and luxurious. I was at this hotel on business and it the bar was a great place for casual business conversations. The guest rooms are clean and very well appointed. The bathrooms are huge and equally impressive. This resort isn't "over the top" with its luxury, but like the title of this reviews says, you can't go wrong at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “600 bucks a night...”
Reviews.Author: Grizzly78
Reviews.Content: ... And they stil want you to pay $14.99 for 24 hours of Internet? This smacks of cheapness and just gives the impression that you're being ripped off. It costs fifty bucks A MONTH to get it in my home. That's a 900 percent markup. Aside from that, it's a jolly nice hotel and I'd reccomend it to anyone with a company credit card or money to burn

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: patrickwNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Four Seasons in SF for the second time & had an amazing time! I arrived early around 11:30a, & of course, my room was ready & the check-in experience w/ Nick was quick, efficient & welcoming. The first time I stayed at the hotel I faced Market St which was very quiet & a nice view of the streets below, but when I made my reservation w/ the hotel, I requested to be on the opposite side of the hotel just to see the difference in views. I really loved the view this time. My room (1522) had a spectacular view of the city, ocean & mountains- I could also see the Yerba Buena Gardens & MOMA SF. The rooms at the hotel are incredibly silent--you can't hear anything- the windows are very well-insulated which is really appreciative when traveling far. The king bed is amazing- so comfortable & instantly engulfing with really soft sheets & good pillows:) The closet is spacious, the bathroom is quite large, with a separate area for the toilet, an indulgent deep-soaking tub, nice shower & plenty of counter space with the typical L'Occitane toiletries that all Four Seasons provide. Very nice bathroom overall!! the desk area is spacious with a cool lamp, the TV was perfect reception & several channels, the carpet is super soft & comfortable to walk on, & I love the color scheme, which has shades of yellow which are really mellow & soothing to me. The entire room was warm, comfy & understated- perfect for me! I love the rooms at the hotel. The service is generally great....Joel at the Front Desk was awesome- super friendly, incredibly quick & a pleasure to speak with! the Room service staff, including Mike, Catherine & Rolland were great- very friendly, always willing to take special orders (i was craving a BLT & they made a great sandwich!!--the truffle fries are also insanely good:) & the service was really fast. I never waited very long for any of my orders. the next morning I ordered breakfast & had the most delicious Freshly Squeezed Orange, Pineapple, Papaya Juice, which was the Juice of the day- amazing! the Concierges are very knowledgeable & patient- a great team of people! The location is perfect! Near a BART metro, Union Sq. Shopping, the Ferry Building, SOMA, etc. I adore & love this hotel- it's always so comfortable & nice & welcoming to come back here every time I visit San Francisco- it feels like home when I'm this far away from New York! Best, Patrick Winkler NYC

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Lucy_Jones
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and had a great time. The service was excellent and the rooms were beautiful and equipped with everything you might need. I was pleased we had chosen this location as it was within relatively easy reach of all the sights. We felt it was a nicer area to stay than Fisherman's wharf. It was also very near all the shops which was great! We ate in the hotel a couple of times and had a lovely meal both times. The breakfast (we had room service) was fantastic. We'd definitely return again if we were in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Service, Not Worth the Price Point in SF”
Reviews.Author: TravelCR
Reviews.Content: I loved our trip out to California, but this is the one segment that I did not look forward to writing about when we returned. One of the reasons we chose this hotel was because I have read many reviews over the years about the unique level of service within Four Seasons properties. This trip provided an opportunity for us to become acquainted with the brand. Unfortunately, our first impression was not as favorable as I had hoped in regards to some service on our first night. We had arranged car service privately, and when our driver pulled up to the covered transportation area, we were not greeted or offered assistance with our bags. This was not a significant problem since my husband keeps straps to tether the bags in the top pocket (which helped to get them inside without a cart), but it was surprising. Thankfully, we were warmly greeted upstairs for check-in. We stayed in a Deluxe Room, which was clean with a comfortable bed, soft linens, spacious bathroom with separate shower, and a dedicated work area. I did not take pictures since the room was just as expected given the photos online and on their website. After getting ourselves settled in the room, we went downstairs to go out for dinner. We had read about the courtesy car service (another reason we had chosen the hotel since we had dropped off the rental car) and asked the doorman if we could get a ride to dinner. He said it would be a twenty-minute wait, which was no problem, so we had a seat on the bench. He was not familiar with our restaurant, Nopalito, and when I mentioned it was on Broderick, he seemed ambivalent about taking us, so I explained that it was within their 3-mile radius. When the driver returned and we got in the car, it was clear in the doormanâ€™s verbal and non-verbal communication to the driver that he seemed a bit put out at our destination. We were not sure why, so we just went ahead with our plans. Upon arrival at the restaurant, the driver gave us the phone number to call for a return trip back to the hotel and gave us two names to ask for when we called; he recommended we call 10 to 20 minutes before we were ready to go. Partly because of the doormanâ€™s behavior as we left, I made sure to tip the driver generously before we went into the restaurant. Near the end of our meal, my husband called the number he was given. He was told that it was a busy night for taxi drivers and the courtesy car was therefore busy. (Being busy was understandable, we knew this service is first-come, first-served; this is why we did not mind waiting.) My husband said the wait was fine since we were enjoying the night out, even when he was told the car would not be available for at least an hour. The Four Seasons staff member then responded by saying they could not guarantee they could pick us at all and said we should get a taxi. We got a taxi and the drive back to the hotel was considerably faster; it was less than ten minutes straight down Market via Fell and just over two miles, so I am not sure that the original driver was familiar with the route, which may be why it seemed out of the way to door man. In conversation with the taxi driver, he mentioned what a slow night it was. This was a surprise given what we had been told by the Four Seasons staff member. Given this detail, and the sense we had earlier that the staff member seemed out of sorts, things just were not adding up. As soon as we arrived to the Four Seasons I picked up a lobby phone and called down to ask the wait for the courtesy car - a surprising twenty to twenty-five minutes. At this point we felt lied to by the staff member. There was neither an hour plus wait for a car, nor was it a busy night for taxis. If they did not want to provide service, they just should have said so in the first place. I could not recall the name of the primary doorman my husband had been in communication with, so I immediately went to the front desk to ask to speak to a manager so that he/she would have an easier time figuring out who we interacted with that evening.
